transliteration: Outhe Boor Maanoo|| Ddare Baan Paanoo||15||92||
translation: The most honoured warriors arose with bow and arrows in their hands.15.92.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਰੋਸ ਗੱਜੇ || ਤੁਰੀ ਨਾਦ ਬੱਜੇ ||
transliteration: Mahaa Ros Gadje|| Turoo Naad Bajje||
translation: They are raaring in great anger, and the clarionets and drums are being played.

transliteration: Bhare Ros Bhdaroo|| Mache Chhattra Dhdaroo||16||93||
translation: Filled with great fury, the wielders of canopies are much excited.16.93.

gurmukhi: ਹਕੰ ਹਾਕ ਬੱਜੀ || ਫਿਰੈ ਸੈਣ ਭੱਜੀ ||
transliteration: Hakan Haak Bajjoo|| Phirai Sain Bhajjoo||
translation: There are shouts after shouts and the forces are running hither and thither.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਯੋ ਲੋਹ ਕ੍ਰੋਹੰ || ਛਕੇ ਸੂਰ ਸੋਹੰ ||੧੭||੯੪||
transliteration: Daryo Loh Krohan|| Chhake Soor Sohaaan||17||94||
translation: With great ire, the steel is being used, and the inebriated warriors look glorious.17.94.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗੰ || ਦਵੰ ਜਾਨੁ ਦੰਗੰ ||
transliteration: Gire An Bhanadg|| Davan Jaan(u) Danndan||
translation: The warriors with chopped limbs have fallen and the red blood appears like flaming fire.
The jingling and the twanging sounds of weapons are being heard.18.95.

gurmukhi: ਕਟਾ ਕੱਟ ਬਾਹੈ || ੳੁਭੈ ਜੀਤ ਚਾਹੈ ||
transliteration: Kataa Katt Baahai|| Oubhai Jeet Chaahai||
translation: The weapons are being struck with clinking sound and both sides wan their victory.

transliteration: Mahaan Madd Maate|| Tape Tej Taate||19||96||
translation: Many are intoxicated with wine and in great fury, they appear highly inflamed.19.96.

gurmukhi: ਰਸੰ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਰਾਚੇ || ੳੁਭੇ ਜੁੱਧ ਮਾਚੇ ||
transliteration: Rasan Rudra Raache|| Oubhe Juddh Maache||
translation: They are flushed with rage and are absorbed in waging war.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੈਂ ਬਾਣ ਅਰਚਾ || ਧਨੁਰ ਬੇਦ ਚਰਚਾ ||੨੦||੯੭||
transliteration: Karaoon Baan Archaa|| Dhanur Bed Charchaa||20||97||
translation: They offer arrows and are discussing archery.20.97.

gurmukhi: ਮਚੇ ਬੀਰ ਬੀਰੰ || ੳੁਠੀ ਝਾਰ ਤੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Mache Boor Booran|| Outhoo Jhaar Tooran||
translation: The heroes are absorbed in heroic feats and are rainiong the shafts.

transliteration: Gado Gadd Phorain|| Nahoon Nain Morain||21||98||
translation: They are penetrating into the warrior-stronghold and do not turn away their eyes from it.21.98.
They are striking their weapons, facing the enemy and are pulling their bow-strings.
